title: How to Make Steps in a Garden Walk
summary: Steps in garden walks are perhaps most easily and artistically made as shown below. These instructions are for a set of four steps which will be three feet wide, however the width and/or number of steps can easily be adapted to suit any slope along your garden walk.
actions: {"1": "Drive a stout stake into the ground where the end of each proposed bottom step is to be.", "2": "Form the sides of the step by setting 10\u201d x 6\u201d boards into the bank so their outer ends are flush with the outer edges of each stake and nail them in place.", "3": "Nail a 3\u2019 x 6\u201d board at the front at right angles to the side boards.", "4": "Measure upwards by 6\u201d and inwards, towards the bank, by 10\u201d and repeat the process above.", "5": "Fill the boxes with gravel (coarse below, fine on the surface) and tamp them down hard."}
things_needed: 8 x hardwood stakes, 10” long x 1½” x 1½”,4 x hardwood boards, 3’ long x 6” wide x 1” thick each,8 x hardwood boards, 10” long x 6” wide x 1” thick each,hammer,tape measure,shovel,gravel or soil

title: How to Finish Maple

title: How to Make a Huge Hanging Shelf for a Cabin or Shed
summary: cabin or shed, a simple solution is a few steps away.
actions: {"1": "Work on a table or a workbench for greater comfort.Mark the middle point of the 2 long profiles with a slash on the inner side.Start placing bolts, etc every 20 centimeter (7.9\u00a0in) approx.", "2": "The clamp that holds the secondary chain will be located on a beam at approx 120 centimeter (47.2\u00a0in) from the middle point of the long profile already fixed on the wall.", "3": "Take the last double short profile and make it sit on the middle points of the long profiles.", "4": "Fix it to the frame with 4 bolts, etc.", "5": "Insert the boards diagonally, first let them sit on the wall long profile and lower them until they're encased and secured by the half frames."}

title: How to Make a Slippery Nipple Layered Shooter
summary: A Slippery Nipple is a layered shooter (or shot) that is made by first layering Baileys Irish Cream over Sambuca. Less Baileys is used then Sambuca because a thin layer of Baileys is created over the Sambuca. Then a drop of grenadine is dripped onto the layer of Baileys, creating a red indentation in the layer of Baileys that looks like a nipple.
actions: {"1": "Set a shot glass or cordial glass on a table.", "2": "Pour the Sambuca directly into the glass so that it fills up a little less than three-fourths of the glass.", "3": "Using the technique described in the article Make Layered Shots, layer the Baileys Irish Cream over the Sambuca.", "4": "Drip one single drop of grenadine onto the center of the top of the layer of Baileys Irish Cream.", "5": "Serve the drink."}
things_needed: 3/4 oz (22.5 mL) Sambuca,1/4 oz (7.5 mL) Baileys Irish Cream,Drop grenadine

title: How to Root Forsythia
summary: Forsythia is a hardy, colourful bush that can brighten up any garden and help to attract birds, bees and butterflies. Forsythia plants tend to root deep in the ground and have large root balls, making it difficult to transplant the whole bush. One alternative is to root forsythia and create smaller offshoot plants that can be transplanted separately. The process used to root forsythia will vary slightly depending on the time of year and the maturity level of the plant, but a few simple steps make rooting forsythia and expanding your garden easy.
actions: {"1": "Root forsythia after the bush has finished blooming and all of its flowers have fallen off.", "2": "Grow forsythia in well-drained, acidic soil and lots of shade.", "3": "Prepare your cuttings before you plant them to help them root properly.", "4": "Try an alternative method for rooting clippings by bending a branch down from an existing bush, covering the first 6 inches (15.2\u00a0cm) of the branch with soil and mulch, and using a brick or rock to weigh it down.", "5": "Make sure clippings have plenty of shade when rooting and aren\u2019t exposed to lots of direct sunlight."}
things_needed: Mulch,Topsoil,Cedar shavings or straw,Growth hormone,Gardening shears or scissors,Trowel or shovel,Planter box (if rooting indoors)

title: How to Change the Save Data Icon and Background for a PSP
summary: When you look at saved data on your PSP, you see a picture. This is called the icon. If you wait 2 seconds, a background appears. If you follow these steps, you can change them!
actions: {"1": "Connect your PSP to your computer using the USB cable.", "2": "Go to "My Computer/Removable Disk/PSP/SAVE DATA/(any file)" on Windows, or "disk/PSP/SAVE DATA/(any file)" on Linux-based systems.", "3": "Edit the file icon0.PNG and pic1.PNG############", "4": "Safely disconnect your PSP.", "5": "Look at the save on your PSP (under "Game > Saved Data Utility")!"}
things_needed: Windows Operating System,Proper USB cable

summary: Hunting rocks can be a fun and sometimes rewarding pastime. It's easy, whether you know it or not, rocks are all around you.
actions: {"1": "Find a mineral site close to you:", "2": "Ensure you have the right equipment:", "3": "Make a very good map of where you're going.", "4": "Have a go at it:", "5": "Identify what you find:"}
things_needed: Geologists hammer (regular hammer will suffice if you don't want it again),Goggles (a must have),Pick (screwdriver will do),Something to loosen hard soil,Clear zip bags to put small finds in,Magnifying glass to see small crystals,Rock identification book,(Optional): A marker (preferably one that will not wash off, a Sharpie will suffice,) or some labels of what you think you might find, just in case you find what you are looking for, or a label maker (but that might possibly be a little cumbersome to bring,) or some other way of identifying the bags and/or containers in which you contain your rock and/or stone and/or mineral and/or metal and/or other specimens.,(If going spelunking or to a cave or other dangerous place to find specimens,): A friend so as to not get lost alone, or to help with finding specimens, or to go contact help if you, or someone else gets lost, stuck, or in some other kind of trouble.

title: How to Make Funfetti Dip
summary: Who doesn’t love funfetti cupcakes? Well this delicious dip turns everyone’s favorite cake batter into a light and sweet dip that is sure to be the hit of the party. This dip is great for any occasion or holiday because it is easy and relatively quick, and you can decorate it with sprinkles or other edible holiday decorations to suit the mood. It can be served with a variety of options as well, graham crackers, vanilla wafers, teddy grams, or animal crackers.
actions: {"1": "In a large bowl pour in cake mix, yogurt, and Cool Whip.", "2": "Mix until smooth and well blended.", "3": "Chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours minimum.", "4": "Move into a serving dish and add any extra toppings.", "5": "Serve with your favorite snack!"}
things_needed: 1 box (18.9 oz) of funfetti cake mix (can use holiday boxes as well),2 cups Cool Whip (lite or regular),2 cups vanilla yogurt (regular or Greek),Optional- sprinkles (for extra decoration),1 box of your favorite treat to serve with (listed above)

title: How to Use an Emergency Fire Starter
summary: An emergency fire starter can be a useful tool and vital to your survival when you camp or spend time in the wilderness. Emergency fire starters generally resemble rectangular blocks and are made from magnesium, which is a highly flammable element that can be manipulated to start a fire. Most magnesium fire starters have built-in knives or blades that are used to shave pieces of the magnesium from the block, which are then used to ignite the fire from sparks generated from flint. Continue reading this article to learn all about how you can safely and effectively use an emergency fire starter.
actions: {"1": "Gather kindling and tinder for your fire.", "2": "Place your tinder in the designated spot for the fire.", "3": "Shave magnesium from your fire starter onto the pile of tinder.", "4": "Ignite the fire using the flint portion of your emergency fire starter.", "5": "Maintain the fire."}
things_needed: Magnesium fire starter block,Steel knife or sharp blade,Tinder and kindling

title: How to Make a Soft Cave for Your Teddy Bear

Since teddies shouldn't be allowed to always get their own way, and are soft toys, why not make your cuddly friend a 'soft' cave? Read on from step number one below to find out how.
actions: {"1": "Find a suitable item to use a the cave.", "2": "Find at least one bathroom rug or bath mat.", "3": "Fnd at least three small blankets.", "4": "Throw a few small pillows on top.", "5": "Put some toys or blankets into the soft cave for you teddy to enjoy."}

title: How to Paint Black Wrought Iron
summary: Wrought iron is an iron alloy that is known for its malleability and durability. While rarely used in structural or other commercial applications, it is a common material used for fences, outdoor railings, and outdoor furniture. It has a very dark appearance (unlike polished steel, for example), and is often painted black when used in outdoor applications. Painting wrought iron can improve its appearance and protect it from rust. Whether you are painting an unfinished piece or refreshing an old coat of paint, learning how to paint black wrought iron will allow you to protect and preserve your outdoor fences and furniture.
actions: {"1": "Scrub away any rust from the wrought iron.", "2": "Sand the wrought iron.", "3": "Apply a coat of rust inhibiting primer to the wrought iron.", "4": "After letting the primer dry completely, sand it lightly with medium-grit sandpaper.", "5": "Apply paint to the wrought iron."}
things_needed: Wrought iron,Stiff wire brush,Sandblaster (optional),Medium-grit sandpaper,Rust inhibiting primer,Paintbrush,Tack cloth,Exterior enamel paint,Paint sprayer (optional),Gloves,Dust mask

title: How to Cut a Papaya

title: How to Build Deck Stairs
summary: You normally don't give much thought to building a set of deck stairs. But, when the time comes, you should check out Internet sites for advice or attend a DIY clinic at your local home improvement store. This and the tips provided below will help you build deck stairs and gain easy access to a tall wooden porch.
actions: {"1": "Include certain basic or nominal features, such as a minimum width of 48 inches (1200 mm), tread of 10.5 inches (275 mm), and a height of the riser or step of approximately 7-to-8 inches (175-to-200 mm) in your design.", "2": "Measure the height of the stair from the bottom of the decking -- or top of the floor joist -- to the ground and then divide by the 7-to-8 inches (175-to- 200 mm).", "3": "Lay out the steps on the stringer, using 2 x 12-inch (50 x 304 mm) treated wood, with a framing square.", "4": "Cut the riser and steps out with a circular saw, but stop just short of cutting through.", "5": "Install the stringers by attaching them at the top of the deck outside the framing using metal floor joist hangers."}
things_needed: 3-inch (75 mm) deck screws,2 x 12 (50 x 300 mm) treated wood for stringers,Metal floor joist hangers,Treated wood for risers,5/4 wood composite decking width,Circular saw,Hand saw,Cordless screwdriver,Hammer,Framing square

title: How to Harden Modeling Clay
summary: Modeling clay isn't meant to be dried or hardened. Modeling clays contain oil along with regular clay. These oils make them impossible to harden, and trying to stick them in the oven — like you might with regular clay — would cause the clay to melt into a puddle. Modeling clays were designed to be like this, however. They were meant to be worked with the hands, sculpted into a model for inspiration, and then broken down before assuming a new shape. If you happen to have one of the following clays and want to harden it, however, see Step 1 for more advice.
actions: {"1": "Identify the kind of clay with which you're working.", "2": "Apply any pigments or glazes appropriate for painting on prior to hardening the clay.", "3": "Bake polymer clay and oven-hardening clay in a regular kitchen oven.", "4": "Use patience when waiting for self-hardening clay to harden.", "5": "Schedule time in a professional kiln to harden fine art clay."}
actions_img: {"1": "https://www.wikihow.com/video/2/2d/Harden Modeling Clay Step 1.360p.mp4", "2": "https://www.wikihow.com/video/4/41/Harden Modeling Clay Step 2.360p.mp4", "3": "https://www.wikihow.com/video/b/b1/Harden Modeling Clay Step 3.360p.mp4", "4": "https://www.wikihow.com/video/2/2d/Harden Modeling Clay Step 4.360p.mp4", "5": "https://www.wikihow.com/video/d/d5/Harden Modeling Clay Step 5.360p.mp4"}
things_needed: Clay model,Wax paper,Baking sheet,Oven

title: How to Fertilize Carnivorous Plants
summary: Carnivorous plants thrive mainly on moist soil and insects, unlike most other plant breeds that require water and fertilizer that contain many nutrients. Since carnivorous plants rely on insects as their main food source, most carnivorous plant breeds have been grown to adapt to humid, sunny conditions in soil lacking in nutrients. With the right type of treatment, your carnivorous plants can healthily survive and thrive with little maintenance.
actions: {"1": "Place your carnivorous plants in soil that lacks nutrients.", "2": "Supply your plant with water that does not contain nutrients.", "3": "Keep the soil of your carnivorous plants damp or wet.", "4": "Expose your carnivorous plants to sunlight at all times.", "5": "Fertilize your carnivorous plants with insects."}

title: How to Make Tofu Chicken Fingers

actions: {"1": "Cut the firm tofu into "fingers".", "2": "Roll in the egg or egg substitute.", "3": "Roll in the cornflake crumbs.", "4": "Fry in a shallow pan until golden############", "5": "Serve with dark green veggies and a salad to make up for the frying."}
things_needed: Knife and cutting board,Frying pan,Spatula or tongs,Sauce dish

title: How to Fix a Wheelbarrow Tire (tubeless)
summary: An easy solution to lining up a tubeless tire to the rim for a wheelbarrow to fill it back with air - happy days.
actions: {"1": "In most cases your wheelbarrow tire has become flat due to the cold weather, but if it has been punctured you should plan to fix the hole with a tire repair kit.", "2": "Once the tire is ready for inflating, clean the tire bead, (the area that will be in contact with the metal rim) and remove all dirt.", "3": "Apply tire bead sealer or dish soap to assist in the bonding process.", "4": "Wrap a tie down around the center of the tire tread and start to cinch up until the bead presses up against the rim.", "5": "Inflate the tire using a compressor (found at a gas station), or a small compressor that plugs into your cigarette lighter."}
things_needed: Tie Down, long enough to wrap around the tire,Tire bead sealer or grease,Soapy water in spray bottle,Air compressor (usually at a gas station)

title: How to Take a Picture of Your Character on Wonderland Online
summary: As a fast growing online game, Wonderland Online has many servers to enjoy. There are many questions floating around. Here is one common question: "How do I take a picture of my character?" If you wonder this question also, then this is the right article for you! Read on and enjoy!
actions: {"1": "Get your character into a pose you would like to use for your picture.", "2": "When ready, hold alt then press "P" on your keyboard.", "3": "It should say it has taken a picture and it has been saved to your computer as JPG, PNG, etc.", "4": "Go to "My Computer" and go to the "Wonderland Online" folder.", "5": "Enjoy your new picture!"}
things_needed: Wonderland Online,Game Character,Computer/Laptop

title: How to Finely Shave Chocolate
summary: Finely shaved chocolate is ideal for adding to cake and dessert pie toppings and for sprinkling over candies and molded chocolate. It's easy to make provided you have the right equipment.
actions: {"1": "Purchase a very fine grater; the best sort is a "microplane" that is specifically made for grating chocolate.", "2": "Use a safe surface to grate on, to prevent slipping.", "3": "Run the chocolate over the grater.", "4": "If you don't have a microplane, try using a peeler.", "5": "Save yourself a little effort and purchase a chocolate mill."}
things_needed: Chocolate microplane or very fine grater,Non-slip surface such as a silicone mat or solid wooden or plastic chopping board,Peeler

title: How to Get the Best from Your Fruit Plants and Trees Through Feeding and Mulching
summary: Gardeners can either use organic or inorganic material to mulch. There are various types of organic and inorganic materials that gardeners use. There are also advantages and disadvantages to using each material. For example, on the one hand, leaf mould (an organic material) is great for enhancing the condition of the soil but leaf mould requires a little management and takes awhile to decompose and become compost. On the other hand, black plastic polythene (an inorganic material) is easily available and cheap but doesn't look good.
actions: {"1": "Select what mulch you are going to use.", "2": "The optimal time to start mulching is during spring.", "3": "Remove any weeds and ensure you get the roots out as well so they don't grow back into your mulch later on.", "4": "Ensure that the soil around your fruit trees is covered with a generous layer of mulch.", "5": "Well done."}
things_needed: a garden fork to work in the previous year's mulch,a wheelbarrow to carry your mulch,a garden spade,gardening gloves

title: How to Make a Minute to Win It Game
summary: Do you know the Minute to Win It game show? Yes, this is a game show on TV that used home tools for games. Do you want to make it for your party? Here is how to make a Minute to Win It game as fun as the real one.
actions: {"1": "Plan your type of Minute to Win It game.", "2": "You need to find the Minute to Win It games or your own games to play it.", "3": "You will need materials to run a game.", "4": "Get ready with the 60 seconds timer and your games' materials.", "5": "Give the awards."}
things_needed: A 60 seconds timer or a stopwatch,Materials for games,Awards (Recommended),A wide field

title: How to Make Strawberries and Cream Mug Cake
summary: Makes 1 cake.
actions: {"1": "In a medium bowl, combine the ingredients until well mixed.", "2": "Lightly grease the inside of a mug with cooking spray.", "3": "Carefully pour the mixture until the mug is half full.", "4": "Heat the mixture in the microwave for about 3 to 4 minutes.", "5": "Garnish the mug cake with strawberries and whipped cream."}
things_needed: Medium bowl,Coffee mug,Microwave
